title: Border, early 17th century
medium:
Medium: linen, gold metallic foil wound onto yellow silk
Technique: grid of laid cords with needle lace (reticella style)
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Fragment of a deep lace border with figures of St. Anthony and the Christ Child, flanked by large geometric rosettes, interspersed with floral and foliated forms. Upper and lower borders have geometric motifs in an alternating pattern.

tombstone.epitaph:
Border, early 17th century.
early 17th century. Medium: linen, gold metallic foil wound onto yellow silk
Technique: grid of laid cords with needle lace (reticella style). Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-50-210.
